wikipedia_page.main: Kizzy Meriel Crawford (born 25 April 1996), known as Kizzy, is a Bajan-Welsh singer songwriter from Merthyr Tydfil, who sings in both English and Welsh, using traditional and modern sources.

response: 2016 Dennis Rollins, Nerija, Kizzy Crawford, Dowally, GSD Ensemble, Carvela, Asterope, Dani Sicari and the Easy Rollers, Lieko Quintet, Wonderbrass, Bahla, Artephis, Jacqui Dankworth, Andy Nowak Trio, Simon Deeley Quartet, Capital City Jazz Orchestra, Tina May, Geoff Eales, Brownfield Byrne, Trish Clowes.
*25 April - Kizzy Crawford, Bajan-Welsh folk-pop crossover singer-songwriter

There's a mixture of items included on Ochr 1 such as live studio sessions by bands such as Sŵnami, Yws Gwynedd, Cowbois Rhos Botwnnog, Kizzy Crawford and more, as well as videos directed by some of the most up and coming directors in Wales, and interviews with artists of the Welsh music scene in different locations across Wales. Popular artists such as HMS Morris, Candelas, Y Pencadlys Gruff Rhys Gwenno Saunders and Yr Eira have made television appearance on Ochr 1.

A third march took place in Merthyr Tydfil in September 2019. Organisers claimed 5,300 attended the rally where speakers included Eddie Butler, Neville Southall, and Kizzy Crawford. Further marches planned for 2020 in Wrexham, Tredegar and Swansea were postponed due to the COVID-19 outbreak.
*3 December - Kizzy Crawford is among those critical of the proposed design of the 2021 census return form, which includes categories for "Black British" and "white Welsh" but not for "Black Welsh".
* Best New Band or Artist - Kizzy Crawford
* Kizzy Crawford - a Welsh language singer songwriter of Bajan heritage from Merthyr Tydfil
